result.execSummary:
The defendant Arthur Earl Armon Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
08-17-2017/ Judge Michael Hanrahan    
The Court ordered that the privileges previously granted are cancelled and the defendant is sentenced to ordinary confinement for the balance of the term heretofore imposed.     


Huber for work.
Consecutive to: any other sentence.

miscConds.notes: -Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  No DNA surcharge as no sample was taken.  Cash bail on deposit to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Obtain and maintain employment. No geographical restrictions on travel for verified work.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
-No firearms; weapons

-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

timeConds.notes: STAYED until the next court date.

Defendant Arthur Earl Armon in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Defendant Arthur Earl Armon in custody.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Defendant sentenced to serve 6 months consecutive in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  Huber for work to apply.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Court ordered 20 days conditions time imposed and stayed until the next court date.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  No DNA surcharge as no sample was taken.  Cash bail on deposit to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.  No geographical restrictions on travel for verified work.
-No firearms; weapons.

Defendant Arthur Earl Armon in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case set for sentencing.  Parties do not agree on what the offer was and a transcript of the plea must be obtained.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Arthur Earl Armon in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  
.
AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Arthur Earl Armon in court.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has lower number case(s) pending.  
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 04 for a Status Conference.  Status conference scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/1/15 @ 1:30 pm
